page.title: 09"Bowcombe"-Farming Changes 2
page.content: Like other farmers; Bowcombe's farmers have mixed feelings towards the{European Economic Community. On {balance they feel that it has been {advantageous in opening up new {markets, though they resent the quota {restrictions and extra paperwork.} Another trend in farming; that of removing hedges and trees to give larger fields: a system brought about by the demands of modern machinery and the drive to bring more land into use, has in some areas altered the appearance of the countryside,and again brought the farmers into conflict with conservationists, ecologists and country-lovers generally. In Bowcombe, farmers are opposed to this trend and feel that the losses in terms of shelter, wildlife, and the appearance of the countryside are not worth the gain.
